title: Northrop Grumman tests new solid rocket motor technologies
summary: Northrop Grumman test-fired a new solid rocket motor that marks the beginning of an annual test campaign to demonstrate advanced technologies that could be incorporated into space and defense programs.

title: ArianeGroup CEO Finally Says Quiet Part Out Loud
summary:
ArianeGroup CEO Martin Sion has suggested that the company may not have “understood the reality of the situation” when it promised to debut Ariane 6 by 2020. Sion made the comments during an interview with French news outlet Le Monde. The CEO took over from André-Hubert Roussel in April, with speculation at the time that […]
The post ArianeGroup CEO Finally Says Quiet Part Out Loud appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: GAO report recommends FAA evaluate launch mishap investigation procedures
summary: The GAO recommends that the FAA improve its process for investigating launch mishaps, one that currently relies heavily on launch providers.

title: GAO Wants FAA To Improve How It Investigates Space Launch Mishaps
summary: The Government Accountability Office wants the FAA to improve how it investigates space launch mishaps, especially how it decides whether to do an investigation itself or allow the operator to […]

title: Space Development Agency aims high for 2024 after strong 2023 start
summary: The Space Development Agency has set its sights on an ambitious launch schedule for 2024 following two successful launches this year.

title: Lawmakers unveil 2024 defense authorization bill with space priorities
summary: The Senate and House Armed Services Committees unveiled a final National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) conference agreement late Dec. 6 that includes several space policy and spending decisions impacting the military space and commercial space sectors.

title: Boeing working toward first SLS Core Stage final assembly at KSC
summary: As Boeing nears completing final assembly of NASA’s second Space Launch System (SLS) core stage at the Michoud Assembly Facility (MAF) in New Orleans, the space agency’s prime contractor for SLS stages is continuing production of hardware for the next two units. The core stage for Artemis II is the last one that will be completed at MAF, with future builds now planned to undergo final construction at their launch site, the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida.

title: SpaceX launches 90th orbital mission of the year
summary: Just after midnight at 12:07 am ET (05:07 UTC), 23 V2 mini Starlink satellites were lofted into space from Space Launch Complex...

title: NASA revises contract strategy for ISS deorbit vehicle
summary: NASA will give companies greater choice in the type of contract to use for producing a deorbit vehicle for the International Space Station.

title: FCC nod puts Dish-EchoStar merger on home stretch
summary: Satellite TV broadcaster and terrestrial wireless operator Dish Network and EchoStar, its sister company focused on broadband services from space, have cleared a key regulatory hurdle in the way of their merger plans.
